title: Beach House's '7' is a Dreamy Masterpiece
summary: Elizabeth sings about reminiscing about that special moment when it all began with lines like “Reminding you of something you forgot.” “Dark Spring” is the perfect blend of the Beach House we know and love and the change we saw on their last two albums. “Lemon Glow” carries some of the melodies from “Bloom”, Beach House’s first album released in 2008. The sixth track on the album is a beautiful love song that feels like the perfect end to the first half of the album.

This is track number one and the title track, a perfect introduction to Beach House\u2019s take on dream pop on this record. It\u2019s a song about the start of a relationship. Elizabeth sings about reminiscing about that special moment when it all began with lines like \u201CReminding you of something you forgot.\u201D \u201CDark Spring\u201D is the perfect blend of the Beach House we know and love and the change we saw on their last two albums."),mdx("p",null,"The second track on the album is \u201CDive.\u201D This is the first single from the album released back in October of 2018. \u201CDive\u201D is one of the more upbeat songs on the album and one of the best as well. It\u2019s a song about falling in love, with lyrics like \u201CYou fell in love with the sound of the ocean.\u201D This song is a great example of how this album is both nostalgic and fresh at the same time. Something Beach House do so well."),mdx("p",null,"The third track on the album is the second single released, \u201CLemon Glow\u201D. This is one of the more electronic-sounding songs on the album and the first instance of Beach House\u2019s trademark layered harmonies coming through. This is also the first hint of nostalgia that comes from this album, as \u201CLemon Glow\u201D carries some of the melodies from \u201CBloom\u201D, Beach House\u2019s first album released in 2008."),mdx("p",null,"The fourth track on the album is \u201CSkipping\u201D. This is another one of the more upbeat songs and a return to the Beach House we know and love. This song isn\u2019t about falling in love like others on the album, it\u2019s about staying in love."),mdx("p",null,"The fifth track on the album is \u201CGirl of the Year\u201D. This is one of the more interesting choices of song order on the album. It\u2019s one of the slower songs but it has a lot of energy. It\u2019s about the anxiety of being in a relationship and feeling like you\u2019re being held back by the girl you love."),mdx("p",null,"The sixth track on the album is \u201CDrinking Coffee\u201D. This is a beautiful love song that feels like the perfect end to the first half of the album. This song is about reminiscing on the moments that brought you together and feeling lucky someone is in your life. It\u2019s a beautiful song with a catchy chorus, great guitar riffs and a simple yet effective drum beat."),mdx("p",null,"The seventh track on the album is \u201CLurking\u201D. This is one of the more \u201Cout there\u201D tracks on the album, mostly thanks to the synthesizer-heavy instrumental. This song is about the moments that make you feel anxious, like waiting for a phone call or a text from someone."),mdx("p",null,"The eighth track on the album is \u201CTremendous Darkness\u201D. This is a slower and more moody track about accepting the feelings we have that we aren\u2019t always proud of. It\u2019s a song about knowing that you can\u2019t always hide from the things that make you feel bad, but you also can\u2019t let them control you."),mdx("p",null,"The ninth and final track on the album is \u201CDays of Candy\u201D. This is a softer and more minimal track compared to the rest of the album. It\u2019s a song about the things you do to distract yourself from your own thoughts and how easy it is to forget how short life can be. It\u2019s a very sweet and thoughtful way to end the album."),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CDark Spring\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,'"Dive."'),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CLemon Glow\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CSkipping\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CGirl of the Year\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CDrinking Coffee\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CLurking\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CTremendous Darkness\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CDays of Candy\u201D"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
